title: Job Vacancies at ExCare Health
content:
ExCare Health is a primary healthcare hub providing access to quality medication through the pharmacy, Laboratory services, Preventive care through our Vaccination centres and other digital health services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Medical Lab Scientist

Job Location: Chevron, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To perform clinical laboratory tests by standardized procedure. Analyzing blood tissues and fluids, conducting blood tests.
	Setting up and testing sterility of medical laboratory product or equipment and analyzing test results and recording test data.


Responsibilities


	Organize work by matching orders with specimen labeling; sorting specimens; checking labeling; logging specimens; arranging reports for delivery; keeping work surfaces clean and orderly.
	Maintaining a sterile laboratory environment to avoid any cross contamination of specimens on samples.
	Maintain quality results by running standards and controls, verifying equipment function through routine equipment maintenance and advanced trouble shooting; calibrating equipment utilizing approved testing procedures; monitoring quality control measures and protocols.
	Provide test results for patient diagnosis and treatment.
	Provide test results for patient diagnosis and treatment byoperating haematology, urinalysis, and coagulation equipment; performing manual methods of differentials.
	Provide physician with information for treatment of patient infection by performing technical procedures for the identification or susceptibility of bacteria, parasites, fungi, and mycobacteria.
	Ensure the patient of receiving compatible blood/blood components by completing blood typing, antibody screening, compatibility testing, and antibody identification procedures.
	Contribute to a safe and secure environment for patients, visitors, physicians and co-workers by following established standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations.
	Maintain patient confidence by keeping laboratory information confidential.
	Adherence to organizational policies and procedures, professional standards, federal, state, and local requirements standards.
	Take inventory of laboratory supplies and ensure adequate stock levels for essential commodities
	Preparing of daily/weekly report of all laboratory investigations
	Enhance laboratory services and organization’ reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different tasks; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


Requirements


	Bachelor of Medical Laboratory Science Degree (BMLS)
	A minimum 1+ year of working experience in similar Role
	Must be registered with the medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria
	Must possess a practicing License
	The ideal candidate MUST be resident in ChevronLekki, Ajah or environs.
	Good documentation and effective laboratory quality management system skills
	Effective Laboratory data Management and research skills
	A team player and accountable for the quality and integrity of laboratory Services.


Salary
N180,000 - N300,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 11th December, 2025.

Method of APplication 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@excareng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Beauty Advisor  

Job Locations: Chevron Lekki / OPIC - Lagos and Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Beauty Advisor will support customers with skincare and beauty product recommendations, maintain attractive and well-stocked displays, drive product sales, and ensure an excellent and personalized shopping experience.


Responsibilities


	Engage customers and provide tailored recommendations on skincare and beauty products.
	Demonstrate product usage and benefits to improve customer understanding and satisfaction.
	Maintain clean, organized, and visually appealing product displays.
	Support daily store operations, including inventory checks and stock replenishment.
	Build lasting customer relationships through excellent service and follow-up.
	Stay updated on new product arrivals and beauty care trends.
	Contribute to achieving sales targets and overall store performance.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND, or B.Sc. in a science-related discipline (e.g., Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, etc.).
	Must have completed NYSC
	Experience not required, training will be provided.
	Basic knowledge of skincare routines or beauty products is an added advantage.
	Must reside around OPIC, Berger, Arepo, Magboro and environs (for OPIC branch) or Chevron, Ikota, Lekki, Ajah and environs (for Chevron branch).
	Must possess good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Smart appearance, confidence, and a customer-friendly attitude.
	Available for immediate resumption.


Benefits


	Salary: N150,000 - N180,000 monthly. 
	Attractive salary and performance-based incentives.
	In-depth product and customer service training.
	Opportunity to grow within a leading retail pharmacy chain
	HMO Cover
	Leave Bonus.


Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@excareng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail. 

 

3.) Pharmacist

Job Location: Chevron, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Driving Innovation and strategies for sales growth in retail pharmacy.


Responsibilities


	Provides pharmaceutical care through a thorough review of prescriptions as well as through patient counselling for maximum benefits.
	Organize the pharmacy in an efficient manner for easy identification of drugs and sundries.
	Maintain full control over inventory movement to prevent product deterioration and expiry.
	Drive the marketing and sale of services like rapid health checks.
	Drive innovation and keep the company abreast of recent trends in the Health Sector.
	Achieve overall revenue growth, and category growth and drive branch profitability.
	Keep abreast of advancements in medicine by attending conferences and seminars and collaborating with other healthcare professionals.
	Comply with all applicable legal rules, regulations and procedures.


Requirements


	Degree in Pharmacy.
	1 - 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Must have completed or is currently undergoing the mandatory NYSC program.
	The ideal candidate must be resident around Ikota, Lekki, Ajah and environs
	In-depth knowledge of MS Office and Pharmacy information systems.
	Excellent Communication skills.
	Integrity and compassion.
	Valid license to practice the profession.


Benefit


	Salary: N300,000 - N330,000 per month.
	Accommodation available
	HMO Cover
	Group Life Cover
	Leave Bonus
	Exposure toTraining & Development


Application Closing Date: 27th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@excareng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

We help businesses, brands, and institutions leverage technology to grow from strategy to execution. Job Position: Wordpress Developer

Job Location: Nigeria

Description

	We’re looking for a who believes great websites aren’t just built, they’re a result of being intentional with delightful product.
